summary: 17 CFR § 230.134 outlines communications that are not considered a prospectus, provided they are made after a registration statement has been filed. These communications can include factual information about the issuer, details about the securities, and procedural information about the offering, among other specified items. Additionally, such communications must include a disclaimer if the registration statement has not yet become effective and provide information on how to obtain a written prospectus.
